result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake Adam Jalovec was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Blake Adam Jalovec is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Blake Adam Jalovec was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake Adam Jalovec

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Warrant has been received and destroyed.  tw
Request to cancel warrant with Laura N at GLSO-43
sent to GLSO on 10-07-2015  tw
from Clerk to Defendant
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan Agreement.
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
FTP Hearing 08-28-2015 for $342.00

ADDRESS INFO for Blake Adam Jalovec
Current: 16 Meadow Crossing Ct, Greensboro, NC 27410 United States  (Effective: 06-23-2015)
Prior: 337 N. Westhaven Dr Apt 205, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States
Final Reminder Notice sent to Defendant has been returned.  Return to sender.  Re-sent to: 16 Meadow Crossing Ct, Greensboro NC 27410.
Payment Plan Agreement Letter of Understanding to Defendant

1:15 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present with Attorney Michael Sias.

DA recites agreement -  dismiss count 1 - defendant plea to count 2.  Attorney Sias concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 2.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court dismisses count 1.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Sias.  No statement by the defendant.

Court imposes a fine of $150.00 plus court costs - 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 1:23 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
from Atty Michael Sias dated May 21, 2014 - requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing on June 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:05 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Michael Sias.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sias confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status of Prelim in 30 days.

Court adjourned at 9:06 a.m.
Initial appearance on May 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Demand for Jury Trial
By Atty Michael Sias

Roz from Atty Sias called requesting to change the April 28th Initial Appearance as Atty Sias has a conflict.  Matter adjourned to May 12, 2014 at 9:00 a.m.  New notice to be sent.
